interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Rear Window
Review Date: 2020/01/15
Categories: Suspense, Atmospheric, Compelling, Harrowing
Product Description: ['A bored, injured photojournalist confined to his apartment has no choice but to busy himself with observing his neighbors. His voyeurism becomes detective work, however, when he witnesses a murder. Directed by Alfred Hitchcock.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alfred Hitchcock'], 'Producers': ['Alfred Hitchcock'], 'Starring': ['James Stewart', 'Grace Kelly', 'Wendell Corey']}
Review Text: First, I didn't actually rent this video. Somehow, someone hacked my Prime account and rented it. I'm sure it was just a test, to see if they could. I have since changed my password. However, I CAN tell you that, if you haven't seen this movie before, it's one worth watching. It's one of Alfred Hitchcock's best films. And, Jimmy Stewart was perfect in the leading role. I've seen it a few times over the years and really enjoyed it. In fact, there was a remake about ten years ago. But, the first is still the best.
Review Title: Jimmy Stewart and Alfred Hitchcock!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Leitch'], 'Producers': ['Simon Kinberg', 'Ryan Reynolds', 'Lauren Shuler Donner'], 'Starring': ['Ryan Reynolds', 'Josh Brolin', 'Morena Baccarin'], 'Studio': ['20th Century Fox']}
I enjoyed the first Dead Pool movie. So, had to see the sequel. It's just as good as the first. But, there was so much vulgarity in it, I felt a little let down that they had to go that far with it, to push the 'anti-hero' theme.
A great sequel to the original Dead Pool. But, much more vulgarity.
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Français (Canada)', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Français (France)'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch [UT]', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (Latinoamérica) [CC]', 'Español (España) [CC]', 'Français [CC]', 'Italiano [CC]', 'Nederlands [CC]', 'Polski', 'Português', 'Português [SDH]', 'Svenska'], 'Directors': ['Steven Spielberg'], 'Producers': ['Adam Somner', 'Daniel Lupi', 'Chris Defaria', 'Bruce Berman', 'Donald De Line', 'Kristie Macosko Krieger', 'Steven Spielberg', 'Dan Farah'], 'Starring': ['Tye Sheridan', 'Olivia Cooke', 'Ben Mendelsohn'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']}
I like the concept, how they integrated characters from so many of the classic video games. That is what really made the movie. Also, the movie itself was like a video game. That's fun for all you gamers. But, like they sometimes do, in Hollywood, they put all the best scenes in the trailer. So, there weren't any real great scenes left to impress you, as you watched the movie.
The best scenes were in the trailers, but it's still a good movie.
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Anthony Russo', 'Joe Russo'], 'Producers': ['Kevin Feige'], 'Starring': ['Robert Downey Jr.', 'Chris Hemsworth', 'Mark Ruffalo'], 'Studio': ['Marvel']}
If you're an Avengers fan, and haven't seen this movie yet, it's a must see. I was a little lost, at first. Because I missed one or two of the movies leading up to this one. (How the hell did Thor lose his eye?) The cliffhanger at the end was both shocking and awesome. The directors did a good job. I'm fairly salivating for the next installment of the Avengers franchise!
The best Avengers movie yet!
{'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tyler Perry'], 'Producers': ['Mark E. Swinton', 'Will Areu', 'Tyler Perry'], 'Starring': ['Tiffany Haddish', 'Tika Sumpter', 'Omari Hardwick'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']}
I like the Madea character. I like the Madea movies. Of all the Tyler Perry movies, the comedies are the best. His dramas all fall flat on their face. His scripts are too predictable, characters too flat, story lines are like ruts on a muddy road. They follow a path, unwavering, till they get stuck... and.... die. Tiffany Haddish is great in this role. As are the other actors. They all make the movie tolerable. Some movies are larger than the actors in them. These actors are MUCH better than the movie they're in.
It's still a Tyler Perry movie.
Rear Window
Suspense, Atmospheric, Compelling, Harrowing

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Entertainment Preferences:** Enjoys action-packed films, particularly with comedic or anti-hero themes, and appreciates well-made sequels like those in the Avengers franchise. Recently expressed enthusiasm for suspenseful and atmospheric narratives, especially those by Alfred Hitchcock, highlighting a broadening interest in classic cinema. Values humor in films, as seen in favorable critiques of Tyler Perry's comedies, though remains critical of predictability in storytelling.

- **Content Sensitivity:** Seeks engaging narratives while sensitive to excessive vulgarity and inappropriate content, preferring films that deliver impactful themes without gratuitous elements. Enjoys narratives that include surprises and critiques trailers that reveal too much.

- **Viewing Language:** Prefers English audio with audio descriptions, emphasizing an inclusive viewing experience.

- **Rating Behavior:** Consistently rates media positively, averaging around 4.7, but recently gave a lower rating to a Tyler Perry film, indicating a discerning approach to narrative quality. Recently rated an Hitchcock film 5.0, reflecting a strong appreciation for exceptional storytelling and character depth.

- **Engagement Style:** Provides thoughtful reviews, acknowledging performances while critiquing direction and narrative quality. Emphasizes character depth and innovative scripts, particularly in franchises and classic films, valuing those that lead to compelling future developments.

Overall, the user seeks quality in films, valuing innovative storytelling and character dynamics while navigating content sensitivity, and appears to be expanding their cinematic horizons to include classics.
